item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 29, 2024 at 1:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. We've not been trained for this: life after the Newag DRM disclosure [video] (147 points | 18 comments)
2. I don't do Domain Driven Design (16 points | 1 comment)
3. 38C3: Illegal Instructions (206 points | 29 comments)

6. WebGL Fluid Simulation (153 points | 19 comments)

8. Intel's $475M error: the silicon behind the Pentium division bug (253 points | 66 comments)
9. Build a working game of Tetris in Conway's Game of Life (2014) (27 points | discuss)
10. Christmas Punch Requires a Formerly Forbidden Fruit (10 points | 1 comment)
11. McKinsey Destroyed the Middle Class (20 points | 4 comments)
12. Where can you go in Europe by train in 8h? (509 points | 338 comments)
13. I automated my job application process (448 points | 636 comments)
14. Personal Mail Server on OpenBSD (2019) (87 points | 46 comments)
15. Coupling nitrogen-vacancy center spins in diamond to a grape dimer (22 points | 9 comments)

21. Libsearch: Simple index-free full-text search for JavaScript (31 points | 5 comments)
22. Hello World on z/OS (2018) (53 points | 23 comments)
23. The Gambler Who Cracked the Horse-Racing Code (2018) (120 points | 49 comments)

25. Guide to mechanical keyboards (134 points | 157 comments)
26. Finding and exploiting hidden features of Animal Crossing's NES emulator (2018) (92 points | 2 comments)
27. NASA, Axiom Space Change Assembly Order of Commercial Space Station (75 points | 26 comments)
28. Carlsen disqualified from World Rapid and Blitz championship for wearing jeans (295 points | 368 comments)
29. Bad keming: Kerning failures, plus other typographical and font mishaps (65 points | 13 comments)
30. Joco almost died at launch. Now, it's a lifeline for e-bike delivery riders (85 points | 35 comments)
